intro: Helicotropis stenoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, making it suitable for arid or semi-arid environments. Helicotropis stenoloba is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
